result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald C. Rennhack was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay restitution and all applicable fees and surcharges within the term of probation.
Defendant to pay costs and DNA surcharge within the term of probation. Defendant to pay costs of supervision.
Defendant shall undergo counseling for domestic violence and stress management. Defendant shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as recommended by Agent.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone, particularly the victim (Court will allow contact with R.S.).
Defendant shall submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Donald C. Rennhack in court with attorney James R. Mack. Gilbert Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Vicitim is present; Court reviews recomm.; Court reviews charges/penalties; Def. pleads NC to Count 3 CDTP/DAA and Count 4 DC/DAA; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; parties stip. to facts; Court finds pleas made FVK&I and finds Def. guilty of CDTP/DAA and DC/DAA with Counts 1 & 2 D&RI; Victim makes statement; ADA Tienstra is now present for ADA Thompson; State heard; Atty. Mack heard; Court imposes sentence

**W/H - 18 mo. PO concurrent
- $343 CC/ea.
- $200 DNA surcharge/ea.
- AODA & FT
- Counseling for domestic violence and stress managment
- No violent or abusive contact with anyone, part. the victim (Court will allow contact with R.S.)
- Absolute sobriety, no bars, etc.
- Rest. of $82.29
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 17, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with RJS dob 10/7/1979 and her residence.   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

12:46 - Defendant Donald C. Rennhack in court, in custody via video with attorney Bradley Jansen (for SPD).  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets bond at $1000 PA bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with RJS 10/7/79 and her residence.   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Review hearing scheduled for December 10, 2014 at 08:15 am.
